item.title: Report E-2024050322
item.description:
Report E-2024050322

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-06T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: LOGAN
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/14/2024, at 1222 hours, personnel in the CSXT Peach Creek Yard, in Logan, WV, discovered CRDX 14064, a loaded hopper car of Ammonium Nitrate, leaking from the bottom of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, PCS SALES, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0514-00151). SPSI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the release was due to a partially open slide gate on the bottom of the hopper car. CSX Mechanical personnel closed the slide gate and SPSI personnel remediated the product release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Amy James, 803-335-9164). The car was released for transportation.

item.title: Report E-2024050717
item.description:
Report E-2024050717

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: BELLE
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 30-ounces of Victory Fruit & Vegetable Sanitizer was released from one (1) 58-ounce plastic jug due to the container being punctured at the top upon arrival, spilling out onto the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to assist with cleanup. First Call Environmental deployed soda ash to clean the impacted area. The release Impacted an area of 10’x3’ of trailer floor and a 3’X3’ of asphalt under the trailer. No drains or soil were impacted. First Call Environmental recovered the released material and absorbents. First Call Environmental overpacked the damaged jug and recovered material into one 55-gallon metal drum for disposal.
